name: AL Long
text:
Unprofessional and rude.
It took 2 hours just for a consultation! I arrived 15 minutes before my appointment with my paperwork already filled out. I waited in a small waiting room with no space between  chairs. When I was finally taken back I had to wait again because none of my info had been entered from the paperwork I brought when I arrived early. This took a while, but when completed, a different tech took me to a different section to check my eyes. She was rude and acted as though I was an inconvenience to her. I finally asked at one point how much longer it would be before I saw the Dr since I had to go back to work. She said it wouldn't be long and she would check on me in 5 minutes after she sent me back to the bright and packed waiting room with no eye protection after dilating my eyes.  About 30 minutes passed and she finally takes me back to another room. I ask again how long it will be because I HAVE to go back to work. She didn't like that but told me he would be in soon. He finally comes in the room and is in there less than 5 minutes to tell me I'm a candidate for lasik. I was also told that I would have to travel to their Columbus office for the surgery because the operating room there wasn't finished.
My wait was never acknowledged so of course I never received an apology for the 2 hours it took for a simple consultation. And the whole time I was waiting, the Dr was walking back and forth through the lobby as though he had nothing else to do.
Not impressed.

name: alfonzo murray
text:
Hororable appointment,no social distancing,more than one person in very small test rooms.
When I saw doctor he didn’t have mask on and tried too diagnose my condition.
I told him I was uncomfortable with him not wearing mask he had an off the wall excuse for not wearing one.
I asked if it was protocol for not wearing mask I got no answer.
So ended my appointment then and walked out the door..

name: Michael Minor
text: Used this business for 4 years & my fiance broke her glasses recently so I sent her over. Complete disaster of a visit....Was there for a simple eye exam & glasses. The Surgeon pushed Lasik & even made her an appointment for Lasik @ the Columbus location. Not what she was there for at all. The concern for patients is more or less a concern for Money. Lost her business as well as mine today. Couldn't even provide her with disposable protective sunglasses after dilating her eyes before they got her out the door...I MEAN COME ON.

text: Amazing place to go to! I highly recommend. All of the staff are great, welcoming, and personable! They did an amazing job with my surgery and made sure everything went well! You will not go wrong with this place

resp.text:
Hi Daniel,
Glad you are happy with your procedure. We  appreciate the positive review. Thank you!

text: I can not say enough good things about Dr. Foster and his team.  I had the cataract surgery on both eyes.  My eyesight has been really really bad my whole life. The office runs like a factory, which can be a little off-putting, but is very efficient, and everyone was very nice- you just do not get a lot of time with your doctor.  I commend the office and Dr. Stephens for running a great practice.

name: Kelly
text: My teenage son & I are both new patients here after having been patients at another practice in Huntsville. We changed to this practice because of negative experiences with contact fittings & education for my son and incorrect glasses for myself at the previous place. We truly love this office and the staff who have helped us. Denise Baldwin, COA, Contact Lens Specialist, in this office was incredible with my teenager! He has never had contacts before and she was very patient and kind with teaching him how to wear and take care of contacts. Our previous office was not so at all. We have had to wait a bit once or twice but not for too terribly long. (Most medical offices in Huntsville have a bit of a wait anyway because we're in need of more physicians.) But our brief wait here was definitely worth it due to the excellent care we received. The physician was quick & efficient, answered all of our questions, and wasted none of our time once we got to him. The front desk staff, although super busy and quite overwhelmed with taking temps and addressing non mask-wearing patients, stayed professional and kind and so did the employee at the checkout desk. We will absolutely continue to be patients here. As a nurse myself I am very particular about my family's and my medical office experiences so if I give a place a 5 star I really mean it.

text: Dr. Hubickey's staff were so friendly and professional especially during these difficult times.  All were knowledgeable and could answer any question.  The thoroughness taken to determine which procedure was best for me was extensive and my appreciation for going above and beyond to help me make my decision for what was best for me.  Everything explained before, during and after the procedure was spot on so I knew what to expect.  I'm so thankful that I can see without the aid of glasses or contacts.  I just wish I had done it sooner.  Thanks Dr. Hubickey and Staff!!!!!!!

I couldn’t see 1 foot in front of my face beforehand, and now after both surgeries, I do not need glasses for my near-sightedness. It has been a life-changing experience; hard to put into words. I would recommend both doctors 100%. My son recently had Dr. Hubickey perform his Lasek surgery as well, and my son is nothing short of amazed as well. Phenomenal, professional place.

I made an appointment with The Eye Center and was quickly seen by Dr. Frederick who scheduled back to back cataract surgeries and now I only need readers for reading small print.  After all my years of wearing glasses I love being able to just wear  regular sunglasses and OTC readers when I need them!

When I say it was painless, it was!! I had a good recovery too. I also had to call April late one night for eye drops and she did not seem annoyed about the hour that the phone call came in. I never waited more than 15 minutes in the waiting room so I can not agree with the other comments. If you are thinking about getting Lasik, PRK, LASEK, or any other eye procedure done, I highly recommend them!

name: John Bearden
text:
Regarding Dr Hubicky, scroll down. he is an awesome doctor. We did have a little episode regarding my time sitting too long in the waiting room. .. I left. The next morning, a very sweet lady, Tammy Cantrell called, apologized, and explained that a storm had caused a server to go down resulting in equipment not working. By the way: I am very happy with my vision.
Dr. Hubickey was an instrument in the hand of The Lord that changed my life. 1. I had a reoccurring corneal erosion for 2 years.. that was painful and basically killing me because I couldn't sleep. 2. I was near sighted in both eyes. about -3.0 in contact lenses.
Dr. Hubickey did PRK on both eyes. I no longer have corneal erosion and I see really well.
In addition, April, Katelyn, and others were very professional and helpful. The only regret is that I waited so long to do it.

I've been going to Dr.Stevens for several years for my glaucoma. The doctor is brilliant! Very professional. It's hard to imagine that I could ever find a better person to manage my vision issues. As to some reviews complaining about waits. The waiting time varies, depending on the time of day and the patient load for the day. I have never felt rushed by Dr.Stevens, and that's more important to me than shorter waits in the reception area if those are my two choices. I try to schedule early as possible, which normally results in the shortest waits. This is often true of ANY doctor appointment.

text: Don’t make any other plans after your appt. The wait is ridiculous. I understand being busy but 2.5 hours for one appt is absurd. Everyone’s time is valuable not just Doctors.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind review, Sawsan! We greatly appreciate it!

name: Tammy Cantrell
text: Great doctors and professional staff!

name: Queen B
text: This was by far the worst experience my husband or I have ever had at a clinic. We were forwarded here by our pediatrician and i called a month and a half ahead to make our appointment. Our appointment was scheduled for 3:15pm and I showed up at 2:45pm to complete all of the neccessary paperwork. My husband and two kids, 3years and 10months showed up at 3:15. We waited and waited and waited. We were not seen until 4:30 (now mind you their office closes at 5pm). However I constantly see the doctor and her nurses talking and giggling at a computer in the hallway. So after finally being called in the nurse does some little eye tests and dialates my sons eyes. While waiting i spoke with another mother that said her duaghter was there for her appointment at that was at 4pm. We are then sent out to the waiting room and wait another 20min for them to pull us into the room to see the Doctor. So after being called into the room we again waited and waited and waited. We sait in there for 45MIN!!!! Now it is 5:45pm and my two children are hungry, tired and are frustrated at having to look at walls. So we finally looked out of the room to find out that the ENTIRE Office Staff had left and the doctor was in another room with the little girl whose appointment was at 4pm which was after my son's. When the Doctor FINALLY made her appearance she said my son was fine and we could go!!! 3 HOURS to tell us he was fine! Now mind you on the paper work they sent it said to prepare for a 30min appointment! This was by far the WORST experience we have EVER had and will NEVER return! This Staff does not care for its patients or what they have going on and only want your money and to waste your time! If I could rate them NEGATIVE stars I would!

resp.text: Hi RB - I am sorry to hear about your experience with us. We apologize the the time delay while you were visiting us. Thank you for your feedback.

name: Ellen Cozelos
text:
I expect to have a long wait with a doctors' appointment occasionally, emergencies happen.  But this is an eye doctors' clinic!!  How many life or death situations can happen there?   Our appointment was set for 2:30, finally got out  after 5 p.m.!  Talked with other people waiting, 2 to 3 hours is the norm here....less than 5 minutes with the actual doctor.  Luckily, most doctors' offices no longer practice the the art of over booking like they do here.  Donna Patterson nailed it by stating that to the people of the Eye Center, you are only a piece of paper with eyes (or ears)

Update:  Again they apologize, yet the complaints keep coming in for the same issues.  Me thinks the "apologies sound a bit hollow"

resp.text: Hi Ellen - We apologize for your bad experience with us and for the inconvenience your wait may have caused. At The Eye Center, we strive to give you the best customer service and are always striving to do better. Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback.

name: everlina hervey
text:
My boys order for glasses was  09-10-15. Here it is the last week in October no glasses. The staff response to my questions was "I am not sure"  My boys was had to pick out glasses that they really didn't want but need. The last that rendered services to us was not interested in helping us at all.
My boyfriend went for glasses they was back within a week or less. However, she rushed him to pick out frames he didn't want. She didn't know the answer to question  nor did she try to find out. She was very pushy as if we was taking up her time. He walked away and we pick out his frames. She tried to get things added on that he didn't need.

name: Eric Ibarra
text: The doctor here is great. He is passionate about his work and delivers excellent service.

name: jamie Chun
text: I HATE HERE! They will never tell you how much they will charge you before you pay for it. Staff never knows about your insurance. I visited there just for buying contact lense, I got some tests, and they charged me $150...Also, they put some drugs in my eyes(I don't know what it is) and I cannot see close things for more than 30 min. They will not take care about you and explain any information to you. Never visit here. Terrible!

name: Scott Harden
text: They have a friendly staff and a good selection of frames.

name: Melissa Walker
text:
A close friend took her son to Schaeffer recently. Due to his deadbeat dad not paying child support, the child is on Medicaid, and Schaeffer is supposedly one of only two places in Huntsville that offers eye glasses under Medicaid. The little boy was actually excited about getting glasses - about being able to see the board in his 2nd grade classroom. He was excited by all the cool frames he saw on display. When it was his turn to be seen, he and his mother were ushered to a small table, tucked away from the waiting area, with 3 red boxes sitting on top. In those boxes were dirty frames, with only a few sized for boys and not even a mirror to see one's reflection while trying on. The mother humbly asked a clerk if there were any other options for her son and was told "what you see is what you get" then dismissed as if her presence were a nuisance. The little boy was forced to pick out a pair of glasses that, although he needs, we're relatively certain he won't wear past the 2nd day he owns them due to the harassment he'll receive from bullies in school. So he won't be able to see the board, and his education and self esteem will suffer. His mother was understandably upset, but what can she do? She already works at least 3 jobs to pay for food and bills. Life can be hard. You do the best you can with what you have.

But did this mother and child have to be treated like dirt? No. Absolutely not. The behavior of Schaeffer's employee was abhorrent, at best.

I, personally, have a great job with good insurance and can afford not only new glasses every two years, but new prescription sunglasses as well. Where do I go for my glasses? The WalMart vision center on University Drive. The doctor and staff there treat everyone equally well, no matter how they're dressed, how much they make, or what their insurance status is. I know other high-income families that prefer to go there as well.

I will personally spread this story as far and wide as I can. Shame on you, Schaeffer, for treating ANYone like trash, especially an innocent little boy!

name: Daniel Marchand
text:
This location is very busy, staff isn't as knowledgeable about insurances and what they cover.

I've had issues with canceling/rescheduling appointments, canceled or called to move it when I received the post card, and a few weeks later I get a reminder call again for the appointment that I had changed.

FYI for contact users they charge $75 for a fitting (with insurance), I made the mistake of coming here last year and got sticker shock at the register on the way out - my fault for not asking.  Walmart charges $30, and contacts are contacts are contacts...

name: Jessie Crishon
text: Love Dr. Paul!

name: Becky Fuller
text: I have always had good service here but yesterday was a different matter. I came in because my newer glasses didn’t work for me. I had an eye exam but when  the doctor(?) came in at the last part, everything he spoke and did was so fast, that I understood nothing. He recommended 2 products for my eyes but didn’t write the names down.  When I left. I got a piece of paper without any explanation or recommendation. I am 73 and not as quick as I used to be. I left feeling like I learned nothing and accomplished nothing.

name: Woodward Lamar
text: I arrived early and was received right away.  The staff was friendly and competent.  Dr Swan explained what was going on with my eyes and suggested a follow up appointment.  He answered all my questions.  I was in and out in just over an hour.  Great appointment.

name: Anita Kelley
text: Everyone is so nice and helpful and takes time with you.  I feel like I just got the most thorough eye exam I have ever gotten.  Everything is explained and they have patience when you ask a question.

name: David Melton
text:
I had a nice visit there. Everyone was very helpful. Waiting time was short. Doctor and staff were very nice and informative.
Thanks

name: Theresa Chattman
text: Always happy with Dr. McFaden. He’s very knowledgeable and friendly. The staff is very professional and efficient. Overall a great experience.

name: Lynne Stokley
text: After 90 minutes of not being seen by a doctor yet, I asked at the front desk about the time. I told her we’d have to leave in 45 minutes to be somewhere else. She shrugged her shoulders and said let me know if you leave. Really? Staff is not friendly or helpful. Routine eye exam took 2 hours - surely there’s a way to schedule better.

name: Abundantly Blessed
text: The entire staff were genuinely nice and professional in getting my problem solved. Thanks for helping me so quickly and efficiently. I am feeling much better.

name: Sylvie S
text: I had a great experience during my LASIK screening/consultation. They were efficient and friendly!

name: Rosetta Lovelace
text: Every is professional and friendly.  I enjoyed my visit.

name: Carla Meadows
text: MEP is an excellent place for eyecare!

name: Savannah Stone
text: They are AMAZING!! I was so nervous to have the LASIK procedure done but they walked me through absolutely everything and were constantly reassuring. Best procedure experience ever. I can not recommend them enough!! Dr. McFaden and Dr. Shin are the best!

name: Graham McGalliard
text:
I’ve been to both Prattville and Sturbridge locations for exams with contacts and glasses in the past. I had LASIK April 22 performed by Dr. Swan and the results have been incredible. I could see drastically better leaving the office 10 minutes after. At my post-op appointment the next day I could see almost 20/15 out of one eye. The other eye does have more irritation and dryness and is improving daily.

Dr. McFaden and the rest of the staff have been very helpful and friendly getting my procedure set up and during recovery to help with the irritation and minor swelling.

I look forward to see how my eyes have healed at the 1 week follow-up. I highly recommend LASIK with Montgomery Eye Physicians. It’s been life-changing already.

name: Valerie Turner
text: I had to wait a long tome to see the doctor, over 2 hours.

name: LInda Johnson
text: Very good and friendly.

name: Jenny Griff
text: Took my brother with a disability to office saw Dr. Shin everything started smoothly until he started to examine him. He started yelling to look this way don't blink. I told the doctor he's not deaf and I'm translating no need to yell, well he needs to do want I'm asking. 🤨Really a person with down syndrome can't control the fact that he see's something coming at his eye. He was suppose to take a sample of whatever he had in his eye and the risk was if he moves or blink I could cut his eye. I call our mom and told her the risk and how this doctor acted towards my brother she was not happy nor was I we left but not before I told him that we would find someone that can have the patience and find a different way to do this procedure his response was well the other place you will find a specialist is in Bham and if you don't he will lose his eye. I told him don't worry I have driven to Bham before to take him to doctors and I will make sure he doesn't lose his eye unlike you.

name: Sonja Ethridge
text: Very friendly service and doctors will answer all your questions and give you just about all the information you need,  I especially liked that my doctor gave me sample eye drops to try and that I can get them over the counter or by prescription from my primary care provider.

name: Shemaiah Campbell
text: Most of seemed really nice. But, I came in March 3rd to order a contact lense. Dr. McFaden gave me a contact lense review. One had gotten broken 2 days beforeand. Dr. McFaden said it was ok to go ahead and order my lense now so I can have it on the way soon and if it needed to be changed they will do that on my regular schedule exam on March 13th. I was told by one of the nurses that the order for my contact was put in and there wasn't a payment for today and that they will call me when it came in. Forward to March 13th when it was time to have a regular full exam, I asked about the order, and then that's when I was told I had to make a full payment first before it was ordered. So what they told me the first time was a straight up LIE. My contact could've almost been here by now if they would've just told me that in first place!! Now I have to go with 1 freaking contact in for another 2 weeks because somebody don't know how to properly do their job!! This really pisses me off and Tiffany always have a rude demeanor.  My problem wasn't paying for the contact upfront! I could've done that March 3rd! It's the lie that I was told about the ordering! It's not fun going longer than what I have to with one contact!

name: Karen Harris
text: When I scheduled my new patient appointment almost 2 months ago, I was adamant that I wanted to be seen by an ophthalmologist.  An appointment was made to see Dr. Mitchell and to also see Dr. McFadden for my contact exam.  Fast forward to today, when I arrived for my appointment, I'm informed that it has been cancelled.  No phone call, text, email...NOTHING!  As a matter of fact, I had to call the week before to confirm my appointment  because I had not received any form of confirmation.  Needless to say, I will not return or recommend this practice to anyone.  I did not appreciate having my appointment cancelled without any just reason and then only to arrive and have the lady at the reception desk continuously trying to get me to see another doctor.

text: This is my second review.  Plan to spend more than one or two hours there.  The last visit took three hours.  The previous visit Dr. Swan was two and a half hours LATE for my apt.  Next time I will allow a thirty minute wait then leave!

Apparently he doesn’t like a patient getting a second opinion. He is insecure or threatened by a second opinion, especially when there is such a disparity in the result.

text: Came in to the center as a referral. Navigating through the parking garage was a confusing mess as they are working on the elevator service. Mostly a complete waste of time. Also with the parking voucher, only pay 5 dollers instead of the normal 20 dollers...Never again.

text: This concerns my husband, he started going to Dr. John Mason, when he started having problems with his right eye, to find out later when he was sent to Dr. Mason, he had a Retina vein ocullison in his eye, also better know as a stroke in his eye!  They have done several treatments to his eye especially this last September he had to have surgery when his eye started bleeding behind the eye, they repaired it through this surgery, he did lose partial sight in his eye when the stroke occurred but they have helped him so much to have a balance in his eye to and his other eye to secure that his sight will remain good! He goes for regular check ups about every four months! I would highly recommend these doctors to anyone that has eye issues beyond your regular eye doctor that you see yearly! I imagine you probably need a referral since they are specialist! Be sure and check with your insurance provider!

name: Julie Lance
text: When to Eye Foundation ER today, on website states open 24/7.  My husband got piece of wood in his eye.  We waited an hour and told no physician was there. We left untreated.

name: Grammy Mejia
text: Awesome place. Had 2 cataract surgeries and Dr. Swanner and staff and surgery were incredibly kind and professional.  The best I have ever been treated!!!

text: Very arrogant and rude doctors and nurses, complete disregard to patient's well-being. It's impossible to find anybody, nobody is answering or returning phone calls, very difficult to have an answer to the simplest basic question. Better to use other hospitals.

name: Beth Spitzley
text: Had an amazing experience from the second we walked into the door to the very end as they helped her into the car. The staff was amazingly sweet and very helpful. Definitely the most positive and amazing doctor appointment I have ever experienced since moving back to Alabama.

name: Elysia Bailey
text: I have had to bring my mother-in-law to the eye center a fee times. They always make me feel welcome as well. The rooms are very comfortable. Their food is great. I am surprised by the food every time.

name: Rachel Vega

name: Barbara Wilson
text: Dr was great, explained everything. Staff polite.  Time spent in ER, 11 hrs. Needs improving. Only 1 person in waiting room when I arrived.

name: Will Slappey
text: The other day my 16 month old son needed to be seen here. The nurses gave him a stuffed monkey and were so sweet. The doctor that saw William was thorough and communicated well. This was our third experience here in the last three years, and all of our visits have gone well.

name: Mary Ladner
text:
I just left the emergency room and going in I was skeptical, mainly because I had read the other reviews.  I am so glad I didn't feed into the negativity and decided to judge for myself. Dawn was my nurse and so pleasant and patient with me.  I also was seen by Dr Juan? spelling may be incorrect but also very nice. I learned what my mother had already taught me, never assume you know based on the opinions of others, judge for yourself. Great advice momma R.I.P and thank you. I am still listening :)

Also the Dr. can really rock a handlebar mustache!

name: George Guilford
text:
First impressions are everything in repeat business! I am very disappointed in my "very short" visit with Dr. Rosenstiel and staff. (Well I didn't even meet Dr. Rosenstiel???!) Being that I live in Montgomery, I have to request a day off for ALL my eye appointment visits.  I am not new to UAB Callahan Eye Hospital as I've had multiple surgeries within the last three years there. As a matter of fact I just had an appointment there two weeks ago with the incredible Dr. Priscilla Fowler and staff.   I've been diagnosed with Kerataconus and Dr. Priscilla Fowler is my primary eye doctor.  Dr. Fowler and staff are some of the nicest people I've met in the eye care industry. Earlier this year and this past month I received the Cross-Linking  procedure.  I spent over $6000 within the last three years at Callahan eye.  Dr. Fowler and staff treat me with respect on EVERY visit,  yet on December 10 with Dr. Rosenstiel and staff I felt the lesser of.  This visit was scheduled to replace my old sclera lenses with new.  You would think before my arrival they would've did their research on my condition.  Upon my arrival in the room, Dr. Rosenstiel's nurse asked if I ever had sclera lenses?? (I'VE HAD SCLERA CONTACTS FOR THE LAST 6 YEARS??) From there, he goes straight into and I quote, "before we even see you, you have to pay X amount of dollars!?. Furthermore, he adds, "The Lenses will be an additional $XXXX.XX amount of dollars to get them?   Now at this point I was feeling as though they did not want to help me as Dr. Fowler and staff did you for the last couple of years.?  Now do mind you I've already spent thousands of dollars to get my eyes corrected.  The money is not an option, but I felt inferior to his demands.  I also wondered have they even looked in my charts from previous visits.? "Have they even checked my insurance" I thought to myself?  At that point I asked him a series of questions in terms of verifying my insurances and deductibles. To no avail he says nothing will be covered. Now as I mentioned money would not be a concern as I've spent a lot of money to fix my Eye disease. ( As well as the removal of an tumor in my eyelid two years prior ).  More questions came to mind in this parlay with Dr. Rosenstiel's nurse.  At this point I felt that the nurse is trying to rush me so he leaves then comes back with a business card and prices on it. He then states, " if you have any questions please call Melissa" on the business card. I agreed and proceeded to leave. Upon leaving, I felt very embarrassed to even be there. I rushed out and got in my car. I kept thinking to myself "have they even check my insurance". So I called my wife, and she confirmed we do have Eye insurance.  I decided I needed to call them back to confirm and verify with them that I have insurance, the same insurance I've used last three years. Two calls later and one left message, I still have not heard from Melissa, Dr. Rosenstiel , or the male nurse that was talking to me. I never even got to meet Dr. Rosenstiel??? I will still come up to visit Dr. Fowler but I will do my business elsewhere in finding new Sclera lenses!
Very disappointing!!

name: John McDole
text: Whether visiting the Emergency Room or scheduled surgery this is the place to be for anything eye related. Over the years we have never had a problem or bad experience or even an unpleasant encounter. Everyone is very professional. The doctors offices being within the complex make it convenient and the parking deck connects to the complex.

name: April Mejia
text: Staff was extremely nice and professional. Amazing doctors and nurses.

name: Christy Pierce
text: Awesome atmosphere. Friendly and professional staff. Highly recommend.

name: Ethan Vaughn
text:
I took the day off from work to drive 2.5 hours to take my son here. Apparently the optometrist had to take the day off the day before so she was seeing yesterday's patients as well as todays. Which is fine.
What is not fine is the complete lack of foresight or common courtesy to call today's patients to inform them they may have to wait longer we have been waiting for 2 hours and are looking at atleast another hour wait before our son is seen. This office is a perfect storm of incompetence and disregard for their patients.

name: Kevin G
text: Had a major eye injury last week. The nurses and dr quickly relieved my pain and identified the problem quickly. Today I have most of my vision back due to them.

name: Glenda Cook
text: Spent time and alot of money on the doctors and prescriptions and with no answer about my eye pain.The doctors and staff were kind but it still didn't help in the end.

name: Regina Lavender
text: Best Doctors! Waiting time is cut in half! Diagnosis and exams are private issues. Insurance coverage is acceptable. Lots of parking space. Friendly employees and emergency care is available.

name: Dawn Teeters
text: The waiting room here is really nice. Phone charging stations, comfortable seating, large TV's, and a Starbucks coffee machine that unfortunately is not free. $2 for a small coffee

name: Teresa Hill Berry
text: I hope you have better luck than I did. I prefer the clinic on the first floor the Lyons Clinic with Doctor Reid.

name: Shawna Gomez
text:
Only because I can not put zero as an option! I spoke with a man ,who barely allowed me to even talk, and he kept telling me there's no way my daughter's appointment is there, I still have the letter as proof. My daughter is not even 2 and needs eye surgery badly. Her appointment is scheduled for 4/2/18 but as I said he told me there is no way she has one there.

I have 2 kids they are my world. This issue needs to be resolved. If my daughter doesn't get her surgery because the man I spoke to is incompetent, I'm not going to be a very happy mom and if any of you are parents you'd understand.

name: Chris Mahan
text: It is very concentrated on helping people live better, and the medical staff is excellent.

name: Miss Un-PC
text:
My mom and I were rear ended severely a while back by a young boy more interested in his cell phone than his driving.
At first, I didn't notice anything wrong. Later that night, my right eye had a shadow-like film over it. I didn't think anything about it at first. Later that week, I notice my vision was decreasing. I was half blind in my right eye. I went to my eye doctor. After a check-up, he said my retina was partially detached. And, had I waited a week or so longer, I would've have gone permanently blind in that eye. I got an appointment at the Callahan Eye Foundation.
The doctors, nurses and receptionist were very nice. The surgeon did a fantastic job reattaching my retina. The only thing that was a bit frustrating was that gas bubble. But, it kept pressure on my retina. Now, my vision in the right eye was like it was before the accident.
If you have a problem with your eyes that a regular eye doctor can't treat, then I highly recommend the Callahan Eye Foundation.

name: Jay J
text: I wish I could give a minus star. I stopped by here with a rash on my skin near my eye after hours. I was afraid that it might swell up and cause me further issue. They sent me to the ER. I asked could I see someone not in the ER so I would not have to pay so much, but they said no. So I saw a doc in the ER. He looked at my eye and said it was a common rash and said he would give me some antibiotics. He stepped out with the door open and talked to the nurse. I caught them laughing and looking back at me because I came in for a skin rash near my eye.  I believe I was in there for almost 2 hours and I did not see another patient. The lady at the front desk was rude, the staff was rude and even with insurance I still had to pay over $300 .

name: Bert Bloomston
text:
I was extremely pleased with the  personal care and attention provided me when I arrived at CEH. I arrived a few minutes prior to the appointed time and waited just a short time prior to be taken to a bed where I was prepped for my cataract surgery. I honestly did not have the feeling that I was in a medical facility, but a facility designed  for the extreme care and concern for a person. All of us, I believe, have anxiety prior to a surgical procedure, however the staff made me feel comfortable and relaxed. I took special note that Mr. Sprayberry was on the floor chatting with the patients and the staff. That is certainly a rarity in today's world of medicine and certainly could not be found in many or any facility today. Also, I learned that there was patient advocate on the floor.
Congratulations to all and to Dr. Sara Mullins for the outstanding treatment and personal attention. Your hospital is way above just first class.
Thank you again and I told many of my friends about your outstanding service and personal care.

name: Jim Hennessey
text:
Arrived for my appointment, lobby was empty. The woman at the counter shouted across the room that we needed to wait and she would get with us (me and my wife).

She then shouted across the room about who our insurance carrier was? My wife provided that information and the lobby “boss” we’ll call her because that is the nicest I can describe her attitude.

The Lobby boss then shouted we don’t accept that, my wife replied “yes, you do” my wife checked before making our appointment. The lobby boss then made us shout our  SSI numbers across the room so she could check. Violation of our privacy.

Lobby boss then ordered us to adjust our masks as they did not meet with her approval. Shortly thereafter the “lobby boss” then got into my wife’s personal space and the ordered here to replace her mask as it did not meet with the “lobby boss’s” approval.

At that point my spouse and  I elected to leave. We were going to have vision checks, buy glasses, purchase contacts and have lenses replaced buy two pairs of glasses. That was conservatively a $1,000.00 bill.

Getting into paying customers personal space, treating them rudely, treating personal private information without care is unacceptable.

Avoid this place at all costs.

text:

Cons - I'm 61, worn glasses most of my life, and have had various coatings. These coating have never come off, not once.  It's happened with both sets of lenses from Vision First.  Now I just have annoying streaks across my lenses.  Don't know if I can get a pair without the coating because I can never get through to a real person and never a person from the Pell City clinic.  I've left messages but to no avail.  Very disappointed.
UPDATE Apr 2021 - Went back for an exam and received the same excellent service.  They're just really good.  I also learned that the coating was an anti-glare coating that was coming off.  5 stars for the staff.

name: Lana Robinson
text: I’ve worn glasses since the 2nd grade and, at the age of 50, decided it was time to look into laser vision correction because my eyesight was getting progressively worse. I hadn’t been able to wear contacts for 10 years due to some previous eye problems, and I had really dry eyes. I selected Michelson Laser Vision because he is well-known and respected in laser vision correction. Dr. Marc Michelson spent a lot of time with me before the surgery evaluating the best way to proceed and explained the process and what I could expect after surgery. The surgery was over quickly, and I could see at great distances for the first time in my life! Over the next few days, my vision improved drastically. It’s now been 9 months since my surgery and I can honestly say that having laser surgery on my eyes is the best decision I’ve made! The entire staff is invested in making sure you have a great experience and great eyesight! I feel like I’ve gotten a part of my life back.

name: Josh Kelley
text:
Dr. Michelson and her staff are the definition of professional and efficient. Don’t go see them expecting to spend the day. They have this down to a science. You will be in and out in the blink of an eye(see what I did there??). They are not only fast they are precise. Their dedication to excellence shines through the entire procedure. From the screening to the scheduling to the pre op and the post op. This crews knows what they are doing and is second to none. I’m kicking myself for not doing this sooner.

As far as the actual procedure goes, imagine walking into a room without being able to see anything and then 15 minutes later you can read the clock on the wall!! That’s literally the exact experience I had. I can’t recommend them enough. Don’t tell them I said this but knowing what I know now, I would have paid double.

text: Dr. Jennifer Michelson performed my surgery.  I actually came to Michelson Laser Vision because of a scheduling conflict that I had with Schaeffer. ONE OF MY BEST DECISIONS Contacts or glasses have been a daily chore in my life for 17+ years. I began my LASIK search with another eye care provider. It did not occur to me that I would be rejected as a candidate, until the optometrist (not surgeon) noted a callus due to chronic contact use and subsequently rejected me. Thankfully my husband suggested Michelson where the doctor that would be performing surgery approved me. Dr. Michelson’s years of experience and expertise allowed him to see the callus was not a structural part of my eye and would not prohibit my benefiting from LASIK. Having a one on one with Dr. Michelson prior to the day of surgery was invaluable for me. The staff was very attentive and I felt as though I was in the care of a very competent work family. I felt informed and reassured throughout the process including during the surgery itself. No more foggy glasses, no more keeping a contact schedule or burning scratchy contacts. I would definitely recommend investing in a better quality of life through Michelson Laser.
Thanks to Michelson Laser my vision improved from relying on a -6.5 prescription to 20/15 in less than 24 hours!

name: Catherine Grizzard
text: Having your eyes lasered is not something you go into lightly, so I decided I would consult with two different practices before picking a doctor.  I left the first office with a piece of paper that listed the price of the surgery.  I left Dr. Michelson's office with a folder full of valuable information, including statistics regarding the successful outcomes of his LASIK patients' vision.  While the price wasn't cheaper, I knew this was the doctor/staff that I wanted to operate on my eyes.  The surgery itself was just as amazing as the results.  The operation was completely pain free. The ride home was painful, but I took my Ambien and went to sleep as soon as I got home. After my four hour Ambien nap, I woke up completely pain free and have had no pain since.  I went back the morning after surgery for my post-op and had 20/20 vision.  I'm now eleven days post op and still getting used to the fact that I no longer have to depend on glasses or contacts after using them for 23 years.  I'm so glad I went with Michelson!

text: I had LASIK done on both of my eyes about a week ago and went from being VERY near sighted (-5.00) to 20/20 vision :). Everyone was very friendly and Dr. Michelson did a great job!!

name: Tristin Terry
text: Had Lasik here a while back. They had to do it twice, and my left eye is still not 20-20.

name: India Collins
text: In the back of my mind, I had always thought about finding out more about lasik surgery and always said to people " I would love to have lasik one day".  I could kick myself for not having lasik done sooner! I am 51 years old and as I have gotten older, I began having more trouble with wearing contacts.  I could only wear them for a few hours before they would cause my eyes to get very dry, red and irritated.  Because of this, I reverted back to wearing glasses which I really didn't want to have to do but felt like I had no choice.  I was near-sighted, which meant that I had no significant problems seeing up close, but couldn't see things very clearly at a distance. About 15 years earlier, a supervisor of mine had lasik and mentioned that he had done an extensive amount of research on it and would be having Dr. Michelson perform his surgery. I kept Dr. Michelson's name tucked away in my memory and said that if I ever had it done, he would be the one that would do it.  I made the call to Michelson Laser Vision and couldn't get over how easily it all fell together after that call.  I went to my first appoinment and had several super-quick tests to see if I could actually qualify for lasik.  Margaret and Lauren ran the tests, then Margaret sat down with me and  told me that I qualified for the procedure. They were both great about taking the time to explain the tests and what to expect on the day of the surgery.  I was so excited to hear this news because my eyesight was so bad in one eye and I also have a history of diabetes in my family which I thought would completely rule me out for the surgery. Dr. Michelson asked me if  his daughter,Jennifer Michelson, M.D., who is also a practicing opthalmologist/cataract and laser eye surgeon there at the clinic,could perform the lasik surgery under his supervision. She has done many, many of these surgeries  and is very well qualified just as her father. I agreed, came in a few days later and had the procedure done  which only took about one minute to perform and I was in the office for about an hour total.  There was absolutely no pain involved and I didn't have any trouble whatsoever after the surgery.  The next day I was seeing perfectly with 20/15 vision in my eye that had before not been able to make out huge letters on the eye chart! I was sold! I drove to my appointment that very morning after surgery and  was driving and taking kids to cross-country practice that day as well. To be able to see so clearly things like car tag numbers, street signs and other things at a distance without the use of any kind of corrective lenses was so incredible! If you have ever thought about having this procedure you won't regret it.  It is truly a life-changing experience!

name: Tristin Terry
text: Had Lasik here a while back. They had to do it twice, and my left eye is still not 20-20.

name: Ashlyn Rhodes
text: I would recommend Michelson Laser to everyone! They have the friendliest staff and the best doctors!

name: Emmanuel Ramos
text:
The best professional services in this place.
I recommend to everyone......

name: JUSTIN MOORE
text: Great staff of people who gives you the best experience possible.

name: mark Cleveland
text:
Investigated Lasik last year as a solution to getting my Distance vision back.  After doing some research on internet and word of mouth I visited Dr. Marc's office for initial check-up and felt so comfortable with everyone involved I went ahead and had Lasik performed on both eyes at once.
What a great experience from the immediate outcome to the follow-up care.
I'd recommend Dr. Marc's practice to anyone looking into Lasik.

name: Joey Mead
text: Fantastic staff and doctors!

name: T Lawley
text:
I am 26 years old and have had terrible vision my entire life. I always wanted to do lasik because contacts bothered my eyes and glasses provided no help with peripheral vision. I mentioned in passing to a family member that I was considering lasik and he referred me to Dr Michelson for a free consultation. I can honestly say from the first time I stepped into this practice that I genuinely felt that every employee cared about my concerns and my questions. Especially my lasik consultant Donna. Thanks Donna! I had lasik scheduled for 9:30 am. I arrived at 9:15 and within 5 minutes I was in the back getting started. After all of the final testing and surgery prep I was walked to the surgery suite and the procedure began. My wife recorded the entire surgery and from beginning to end was ten minutes. There was absolutely zero pain during any of it! It has now been 10 hours since the surgery and I can see better than ever before and I know it's only going to get better. I am amazed at how professional Dr. Michelson and his staff are. This has truly been a life changing experience. So thankful that I chose the best eye surgeon in the state to do my lasik. I wouldn't have trusted anyone else with my eyes! You guys are the best!
UPDATE
I had lasik on 8/25 and went in this morning 8/26 for post-op checkup. Before lasik I was legally blind. Now, less than 24 hours later my vision is 20/15 in both eyes! That is better than 20/20. I only wish I would have done it sooner! Thank you Dr. Michelson!

name: Dana Bernardo
text: Amazing experience! I went from legally blind (without correction) to 20/15!

name: Powell Tyler
text: Great Job!  Couldn't be happier.

name: Steven Janes
text: Fantastic LASIK experience!

name: S D
text: Fantastic Vision - finally!

name: M Miller
text: Horrible, horrible, horrible. Had an eye exam and ordered glasses. First pair came in with the wrong prescription.  They redid my eye exam and said they made a mistake so they reordered my glasses. 2 weeks later I hadn’t heard a word so I called. Was put on hold for 20 min. I hung up at 20 min. Called back. Was put on hold for 7 min. Finally told my glasses had been shipped back with demo lenses installed. They apologized and told me when I came in I could select a pair of sunglasses as compensation for my trouble. Another 10 day wait. Glasses come in. I go to get them and ask about the offer of sunglasses. A nasty woman announces loudly from behind a counter that she’s the only person that can approve such an offer and she doesn’t know anything about it.  So I tell her, well, that’s what I was offered on the phone. She tells me she’ll have to investigate it. A little while later they call and tell me that they have “a” pair of sunglasses I can have. No choice allowed. I go to get them and they are a pair that was clearly returned by someone. I ask to speak to the “manager” and all of a sudden she’s unavailable.  These people lie. They are overworked and under supported by the company. I’ll never do business with them again. 36 days to get a pair of glasses is absurd and reneging on their offer is simply amateur.  So sad this is what this business has been reduced to.

name: Jackie Jackson
text: Horrible experience.   This is NOT Schaeffer Eye Clinic! But, they don't tell you that.  I did not get what I asked for and  was told i could not get the custom  lenses I wanted.    Yet, the old pair  of lenses from Schaeffer were exactly what I wanted. Selection of frames, Limited, especially on the high end.  Their service is basic and over priced!

name: Debbie Simmons
text: This was the worst Schaeffer experience I've EVER had. I arrived for my appointment a little early and filled out the paperwork to update my information. I was the only patient in the waiting room. I waited 50 mins before seeing the doctor. They directed another patient in to the room I was already in. On my way out after paying I asked for my prescription and they gave me my old perscription and not all of my personal information had been updated and it was not signed by the doctor - which I did not realize until I was ordering my glasses, elsewhere of course. A very unpleasant experience and waste of time. Very inefficient staff. I would not have given them one star but I could not post unless I did.

name: sara soltani
text: I had a pair of glasses and got a second pair here, but the new prescription wasn't working fine for me so I had to go back to change the lenses. Everyone was nice during first visit, but when I returned, Dr. Benjamin was behaving very badly that I got stressed out. I even asked her about it, but she didn't seem to care and called me confused and said  I don't know what I want! (Of course, that's why we need help of a doctor!) I don't know if she had other problems or what but that's not a good excuse to treat a patient like that!

name: Wade Kwon
text:
For some 15 years, I've been visiting Schaeffer Eye Center under the care of Dr. Patricia Benjamin. She has been terrific: friendly, attentive and wry in making sure my eyes aren't suffering from the glare of all those screens.

I see more clearly thanks to Schaeffer.

name: Tracy Jackson
text: The staff here are very attentive and kind! Always willing to help

name: CAROL SKELTON
text: Not the same service as I was used o with Schaeffer Eye Center, been waiting on the correct glasses since June 14, 2019 and  I am being told this morning (7-25-2019) they expect  them to be in by August 1, 2019.  Very strange.

name: Lindsey Cochran
text: Worst experience ever and they don't even care. Told me I couldn't wear contacts (even though I have none to wear anymore) and I needed to wear glasses, except my glasses are broken and I can't see out of them. Bought new glasses told they would be in next week, but when I called they said it would be another week. I also have an eye condition that requires eye drops but they won't approve the insurance to cover them. So now I can't see, have severe migraines because of it and my eyes burn all the time. Every time I call for help and they speak to me as if I am stupid every single time. Don't waste your time here they don't actually help you they just want your money.

name: Miss Lan Pretty
text: Great service

name: Matthew O'Brien
text: Doesn't open on time.
